sorcer.data

Class DataService

  • java.lang.Object
    • sorcer.data.DataService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FileURLHandler

    public class DataService
extends java.lang.Object
implements FileURLHandler
    The DataService provides the support to serve up data from a directory (or a setValue of directories).

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataService

        public DataService(java.lang.String... roots)
        Create a DataService with roots. The resulting service will use an anonymous port.
        Parameters:
        roots - The roots to provide access to.

      • DataService

        public DataService(int port,
                   java.lang.String... roots)
        Create a DataService with roots and a port.
        Parameters:
        port - The port to use.
        roots - The roots to provide access to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the roots argument is empty or null, or if any of the roots do not exist or are not directories.

    • Method Detail

      • getPlatformDataService

        public static DataService getPlatformDataService()
        Get the DataService that is bound to the platform code server.
        Returns:
        The DataService that is bound to the platform code server, or if platform server properties are not found, return a DataService using the default data dir and an anonymous port.

      • start

        public DataService start()
        Start the data service if it has not been started yet.
        Returns:
        An updated instance of the DataService.

      • getDataURL

        public java.net.URL getDataURL(java.lang.String path)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Get a URL for a file path.
        Specified by:
        getDataURL in interface FileURLHandler
        Parameters:
        path - The file path to obtain a URL for.
        Returns:
        A URL that can be used to access the file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file does not exist, or the URL cannot be created.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the file cannot be accessed from one of the roots provided.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the data service is not running.

      • getDataURL

        public java.net.URL getDataURL(java.io.File file)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Get a URL for a file.
        Specified by:
        getDataURL in interface FileURLHandler
        Parameters:
        file - The file to obtain a URL for.
        Returns:
        A URL that can be used to access the file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file does not exist, or the URL cannot be created.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the file cannot be accessed from one of the roots provided.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the data service is not available.

      • getDataURL

        public java.net.URL getDataURL(java.io.File file,
                               boolean verify)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Get a URL for a file.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to obtain a URL for.
        verify - Whether to verify the file can be served up by the DataService and the DataService is running.
        Returns:
        A URL that can be used to access the file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file does not exist, or the URL cannot be created.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the file cannot be accessed from one of the roots provided.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the data service is not available.

      • getDataFile

        public java.io.File getDataFile(java.net.URL url)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Get a File from a URL.
        Specified by:
        getDataFile in interface FileURLHandler
        Parameters:
        url - The URL to use
        Returns:
        a File derived from the DataService data directory root(s).
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the URL cannot be accessed from one of the roots provided.
        java.io.IOException

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop the data service.

      • getDataDir

        public static java.lang.String getDataDir()
        Get the DataService data directory. The DATA_DIR system property is first consulted, if that property is not setValue, the default is either the TMPDIR System.getProperty("java.io.tmpdir")/sorcer/user/data is used and the DATA_DIR system property is setValue.
        Returns:
        The DataService data directory.

      • getRoots

        public static java.lang.String getRoots(int port)

        public java.lang.String getDataUrl()

        Returns:
        The eval of the DATA_URL system property
